common_ques.ques_1: Name a festival where the day of its culmination is assigned a specific name.

target_claim_mixtral: Thiruvathira refers to a festive event in the traditional Malayali culture of Kerala, celebrated on the day of the brightest star, Mrigasira, in the Dhanu rasi (Capricorn) constellation, which usually falls in mid-December or January, marking the beginning of the festive season.
target_claim_rarr: Thiruvathira refers to a festive event in the traditional Malayali culture of Kerala, celebrated on a day marked by the brightest star, Mrigasira, in the Dhanu rasi (Capricorn) constellation, which typically occurs in mid-December or January, and involves creating intricate flower arrangements called pookkalam (flower carpets) in front of homes to welcome King Mahabali. However, it does not mark the beginning of the harvest season or Malayalam New Year, which is Chingam 1, celebrated in mid-August.
